org.lobobrowser.ua

Interface NetworkRequest

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    NetworkRequestImpl

    public interface NetworkRequest
    The NetworkRequest interface should be implemented to provide network request capabilities.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int STATE_COMPLETE
      The complete request state.
      static int STATE_INTERACTIVE
      The interactive request state.
      static int STATE_LOADED
      The loaded request state.
      static int STATE_LOADING
      The loading request state.
      static int STATE_UNINITIALIZED
      The uninitialized request state.

      Gets the state of the request, a value between 0 and 4.

    • Field Detail

      • STATE_UNINITIALIZED

        static final int STATE_UNINITIALIZED
        The uninitialized request state.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • STATE_LOADING

        static final int STATE_LOADING
        The loading request state. The open method has been called, but a response has not been received yet.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • STATE_LOADED

        static final int STATE_LOADED
        The loaded request state. Headers and status are now available.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • STATE_INTERACTIVE

        static final int STATE_INTERACTIVE
        The interactive request state. Downloading response.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • STATE_COMPLETE

        static final int STATE_COMPLETE
        The complete request state. All operations are finished.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • getReadyState

        int getReadyState()
        Gets the state of the request, a value between 0 and 4.
        Returns:
        A value corresponding to one of the STATE* constants in this class.

      • getResponseText

        java.lang.String getResponseText()
        Gets the request response as text.
        Returns:
        the response text

        org.w3c.dom.Document getResponseXML()
        Gets the request response as an XML DOM.
        Returns:
        the response xml

      • getResponseImage

        java.awt.Image getResponseImage()
        Gets the request response as an AWT image, if that's possible.
        Returns:
        the response image

      • getResponseBytes

        byte[] getResponseBytes()
        Gets the request response bytes.
        Returns:
        the response bytes

      • getStatus

        int getStatus()
        Gets the status of the response. Note that this can be 0 for file requests in addition to 200 for successful HTTP requests.
        Returns:
        the status

      • getStatusText

        java.lang.String getStatusText()
        Gets the status text of the request, e.g. "OK" for 200.
        Returns:
        the status text

      • abort

        void abort()
        Aborts an ongoing request.

      • getAllResponseHeaders

        Gets a string with all the response headers.

        the all response headers

        url - The destination URL.
        asyncFlag - Whether the request should be asynchronous.

        Opens a request.

        url - The destination URL.
        asyncFlag - Whether the request should be asynchronous.

        void open(java.lang.String method,
          java.net.URL url,
          boolean asyncFlag,
          java.lang.String userName,
          java.lang.String password)
   throws java.io.IOException
        Opens a request.
        Parameters:
        method - The request method.
        url - The destination URL.
        asyncFlag - Whether the request should be asynchronous.
        userName - The HTTP authentication user name.
        password - The HTTP authentication password.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Signals that an I/O exception has occurred.

      • send

        void send(java.lang.String content)
   throws java.io.IOException
        Sends POST content if any.
        Parameters:
        content - POST content or null for GET requests.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Signals that an I/O exception has occurred.

      • addNetworkRequestListener

        void addNetworkRequestListener(NetworkRequestListener listener)
        Adds a listener of ReadyState changes. The listener should be invoked even in the case of errors.
        Parameters:
        listener - An instanceof of NetworkRequestListener.
